required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Different Massage Techniques Plus Conservative Applications in Low Back Pain

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare of different massage techniques plus conservative aplications in low back pain treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in low back pain intensity as measured by Visual Analog Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline low back pain intensity at 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life as assessed by Short Form-36
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline quality of life at 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in functional statue as assessed by Oswestry Disability Index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline functional statue at 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in psychologic statue as assessed by Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline psychologic statue at 2 weeks

arm_group.description: Connective tissue massage plus conservative applications including superficial thermal, electrotherapy and home exercise program were applied
Classic massage plus conservative applications including superficial thermal, electrotherapy and home exercise program were applied
Sham massage plus conservative applications including superficial thermal, electrotherapy and home exercise program were applied

intervention.description: Connective tissue massage and conservative aplications were applied 5 days per week for a total of 10 sessions for 2 weeks.
Classic massage and conservative aplications were applied 5 days per week for a total of 10 sessions for 2 weeks.
Sham massage and conservative aplications were applied 5 days per week for a total of 10 sessions for 2 weeks.
